Q-ERP-01.rationale: SAP performs lot determination; Picklist originates in SAP/EWM; MES enforces at execution

Q-INV-02.rationale: APIs/Excipients with expiry → FEFO; Packaging → FIFO

Q-WMS-01.rationale: WMS integrated; TO/staging confirmations flow via WMS

Q-LIMS-01.rationale: Assay/LOD pulled into MES for adjusted qty

Q-QA-02.rationale: All API weighments need verifier e-sign

Q-WB-01.rationale: Ethernet connected balances; Primary path is digital capture

Q-WB-03.rationale: Direct weighing (default); By-difference allowed if manually chosen with reason

Q-UOM-01.rationale: ERP master is authority; MES uses ERP conversions (read-only)

Q-LBL-01.rationale: No extra manual fields; All encoded in barcode; no free text

Q-LBL-03.rationale: Auto-void previous on reprint; max_reprints = 1; audit trail retained

Q-SEC-01.rationale: Facility supports both dispensing methods. APIs (API-1, PVP K30) require weighing for potency adjustment and balance verification. Excipients like Lactose arrive pre-weighed in sealed containers from suppliers. Runtime routing per container based on material class, packaging type, and supplier specifications.

Q-LOT-01.rationale: Multi-lot allowed; Traceability per lot maintained

Q-LOT-02.rationale: Proportional potency; When multi-lot, adjust by contribution

Q-CONS-01.rationale: GI posted when material is actually consumed

Q-HSE-01.rationale: No HPAPI/special containment in this run

Q-ENV-02.rationale: No cold-chain/TOR; Materials are ambient in this scenario

Q-WB-04.rationale: Remove excess to within ±0.5%; If not possible → QA deviation accept (fallback)

Q-ENV-01.rationale: Automated logging via historian; 1-5 min sampling; auto-attach to EBR

Q-QA-04.rationale: MES holds summary & link to full QMS record

Q-DMG-01.rationale: With cleanup + waste logging; minor spills only

Q-INV-06.rationale: Return to stock remnants; Remaining qty captured; remnant label; status=Released

Q-HSE-02.rationale: Partial cleaning between batches; Full cleaning at campaign end (policy-timed)

GRAN-D-METHOD-001.rationale: Typical tableting flow; demonstrates binder path

GRAN-D-CLN-001.rationale: Standard cleaning verification with swab testing

GRAN-D-CAL-001.rationale: Calibration verified before each batch starts

GRAN-D-ENV-001.rationale: Automated environmental monitoring via HVAC system

GRAN-D-BINDER-001.rationale: Pre-made binder batch for wet granulation

GRAN-D-BINDER-QC-001.rationale: Full QC testing of binder solution before use

GRAN-D-RECIPE-001.rationale: Use approved MES master recipe with locked parameters

GRAN-D-SCADA-001.rationale: Full SCADA integration with automated setpoints

GRAN-D-WET-PARAM-001.rationale: Automated binder addition with flow control

GRAN-D-CAPTURE-001.rationale: OPC UA/SCADA integration for automated data capture

GRAN-D-IPC-001.rationale: Test all batches for quality consistency

GRAN-D-LIMS-001.rationale: Bi-directional LIMS integration with auto-import results

GRAN-D-CALC-001.rationale: Automated calculations for yield and material reconciliation

GRAN-D-LABEL-001.rationale: GS1-128 barcode labels with additional manual fields

GRAN-D-RETAIN-001.rationale: Mandatory retain samples with full chain-of-custody tracking

GRAN-D-TRANSFER-001.rationale: Best practice: Granules should be transferred to intermediate hold area for QA sampling, retain collection, and release decision before proceeding to next stage. This ensures proper quality control gates and prevents downstream processing of potentially non-conforming material.

GRAN-D-YIELD-001.rationale: Best practice: ±5% is the industry standard threshold that balances process control with practical variability. Tighter control ensures material accountability and triggers investigation for significant deviations that could indicate process issues or material loss.

GRAN-D-CLEAN-POLICY-001.rationale: Best practice: Cleaning after each batch minimizes cross-contamination risk, ensures product quality, and aligns with cGMP requirements. This is especially critical in multi-product facilities to prevent cross-contamination and maintain validated cleaning procedures.

GRAN-D-ERP-POST-001.rationale: Best practice: On QA approval ensures inventory accuracy and prevents premature posting of non-conforming batches. This aligns with quality-driven operations where only approved material should be reflected in inventory systems, maintaining data integrity and regulatory compliance.

GRAN-D-EBMR-001.rationale: Best practice: Full electronic batch records with 21 CFR Part 11 compliance represent the modern pharma standard. This ensures data integrity, eliminates transcription errors, enables real-time review, provides complete audit trails, and supports regulatory expectations for paperless manufacturing.

GRAN-D-ARCHIVE-001.rationale: Best practice: Electronic archive in a validated system is the regulatory expectation for modern pharmaceutical operations. This ensures long-term data integrity, enables efficient retrieval for audits/inspections, supports data migration, and aligns with FDA/EMA guidance on electronic records management.

Q-ERP-01.rationale: TechPharma performs lot determination in MES rather than SAP

Q-SEC-01.rationale: TechPharma uses weighing path exclusively for all materials. No sealed containers in facility. All materials require balance verification and potency adjustments.

Q-INV-02.rationale: APIs/Excipients with expiry → FEFO; Packaging → FIFO

Q-WMS-01.rationale: WMS integrated; TO/staging confirmations flow via WMS

Q-LIMS-01.rationale: Assay/LOD pulled into MES for adjusted qty

Q-QA-02.rationale: All API weighments need verifier e-sign

Q-WB-01.rationale: Ethernet connected balances; Primary path is digital capture

Q-WB-03.rationale: Direct weighing (default); By-difference allowed if manually chosen with reason

Q-UOM-01.rationale: ERP master is authority; MES uses ERP conversions (read-only)

Q-LBL-01.rationale: No extra manual fields; All encoded in barcode; no free text

Q-LBL-03.rationale: Auto-void previous on reprint; max_reprints = 1; audit trail retained

Q-ENV-01.rationale: Automated logging via historian; 1-5 min sampling; auto-attach to EBR

Q-QA-04.rationale: MES holds summary & link to full QMS record

Q-DMG-01.rationale: With cleanup + waste logging; minor spills only

Q-INV-06.rationale: Return to stock remnants; Remaining qty captured; remnant label; status=Released

Q-HSE-02.rationale: Partial cleaning between batches; Full cleaning at campaign end (policy-timed)

Q-INV-02.rationale: FEFO for APIs and excipients with expiry dates, FIFO for packaging materials
